data.name: Exploring Apache Kafka and Integration with Java Spring Boot - 2
data.detail:
Exploring Apache Kafka and Integration with Java Spring Boot - 2 (Retry Mechanism)

 

We will cover an overview of Apache Kafka followed by a demonstration of connecting to Kafka using Java Spring Boot for both reading and writing operations. You'll delve into the key aspects of Kafka integration within the Java Spring Boot framework.

 

"The leading role of our event is Veysel Gündüzalp - Senior Software Engineer at Trendyol "

 

Thanks to our main sponsor, DefineX, for making this great event happen.

data.name: Istanbul Java Sessions by TJC - vol 1
data.detail:
Yeliz Taneroğlu

Bilgisayar mühendisliği mezunuyum. 6 senedir sektörde yer almaktayım. 4 yıl boyunca dolap app de backend developer olarak yer aldım. Şuanda da Hepsiburada bünyesinde backend developer olarak çalışmaktayım.

 

Onur Aktaş

Kocaeli Üniversitesi Endüstri Mühendisliği son sınıf öğrencisiyim. 10 ay Turkcell-Paycell uygulamasında outsource olarak çalıştım. Şuanda Innovance'da uzun dönem stajyer olarak çalışıyorum. Aynı zamanda Türkiye Java Community'de Co-Organizer ve İstanbul eventleri sorumlusu olarak görev almaktayım.

data.name: New Technologies (Blockchain & Web3)
data.detail:
Ecehan Yıldırım's story is one of relentless pursuit of technology and innovation. It begins with her undergraduate studies in Computer Engineering at Erciyes University, followed by a Master's degree in the same field at Mehmet Akif Ersoy University, where she delved into the fascinating world of artificial intelligence and the metaverse.

 

Throughout her university years, Ecehan wasn't just a student. She actively worked on AI projects, adding another dimension to her skills by becoming a game software developer at a game company between 2020 and 2021. Her hunger for knowledge and experience led her to Liechtenstein in 2021, where she donned the dual hats of software developer and new technologies researcher at a blockchain company. Currently, as of 2023, she continues to blaze a trail at Türk Telekom, one of Turkey's leading telecommunications and technology companies, where she serves as an Innovation Development Specialist.

 

Ecehan's impact extends beyond her career. She is a valued member of Crypto Female premium and WEB 3 Association, where she coordinates efforts in AI and the metaverse. Sharing her expertise generously, she also serves as an instructor at BTK Academy. Her passion for the future of technology is evident in her contribution to Turkey's first Metaverse book, where she penned a chapter on "Metaverse and Ethics." Furthermore, she has shared her insights on global and national platforms like New York, Paris, and TEDX.

 

Ecehan Yıldırım is an embodiment of a woman who embraces technology, champions innovation, and readily shares her knowledge. Her accomplishments and dedication serve as an inspiration to aspiring women shaping the technologies of tomorrow.

 

Tevfik Uyar: İstanbul Teknik Üniversitesi Uçak mühendisliği mezunudur. Yüksek Lisans ve Doktora derecelerini İstanbul Kültür Üniversitesi İşletme Yönetimi Anabilim dalından almıştır. Çalışmaları risk algısı, belirsizlik altında karar verme ve mantıksal safsatalar üzerinedir. Bugün podcast kanalı olarak yayın hayatına devam eden Açık Bilim Dergisi’nin kurucu editörlerinden ve Yalansavar yazarlarından biridir. 2011-2013 yılları arasında Açık Bilim Radyo Programı’nın yapımcılığını ve sunuculuğunu gerçekleştirmiştir. 3'ü bilimkurgu olmak üzere altı adet yayımlanmış kitaba ve dört adet de çeviriye sahiptir.

 

Thank you very much to our main sponsor Definex for supporting us!

data.name: Modular Monolith Development and Agility in Real World
data.detail:
Sergey Ryskin

10 yıla yakın yazılım ve bilişim sektörünün içerisindeyim. Bilgisayarla ilk tanışmamı 4 yaşında gerçekleştirdim. 6 yaşına geldiğimde ise sıfırdan bir bilgisayarı toplayabiliyordum. 7 yaşında ise kodlamaya ilgi duymaya başladım. Java, öğrendiğim ilk programlama dil olmasına rağmen, ilk kodumu C++ ile yazdım ve uzun bir süre robotik kodlama ile uğraşmıştım. Java'yı derinlemesine öğrenirken web programlamasına da büyük ilgi duymuştum. Bunun üzerine Java ile birçok proje gerçekleştirdim, özellikle Fabrika ve KOBİ otomasyonlarına odaklandım. KOBİ otomasyonları yazarken bir çok farklı programlama dili deneyimleme şansım oldu. 14 yaşında programlama dillerini hızlıca kavrayabildiğimi fark ettiğimde, Dart ve Flutter öğrenmeye karar vermiştim. Flutter'ı bir ay içinde öğrendikten sonra, bir mesajlaşma ve iş süreçleri yönetimi uygulaması geliştirdim ve daha sonra orta boyuttaki bir şirkete sattım. Uygulama satışından sonra, hayatımda bir dönüm noktası yaşadım ve 2021'den bu yana startup dünyasında yer alarak startup'lara yardım ediyor ve yatırım almalarına yardımcı oluyorum.

Çoğunlukla orta asya ve avrupa bazlı olan bu startup’ların içerinde Türkiye’de var. Kendim’de 2 adet Start Up kurdum. Bunlardan biri, Harvard ve Westminster Üniversiteleri'nde test edilen bir LMS sistemi. Diğeri ise merkezi olmayan bir restoran yönetimi girişimi olmuştu.

 

Sunum Hakkında

İnsanların ve organizasyonların sürekli değişen taleplere hızlı ve esnek bir şekilde nasıl adapte olabileceğini anlamak, benim kariyerimdeki temel odak noktalarından biri oldu. Bu bağlamda, "Modular Monolith Development and Agility in Real World" başlıklı konuşmamda, Modular Monolith geliştirmenin iş dünyasında nasıl uygulandığını ve bu yaklaşımın Agile metodolojilerle nasıl entegre edilebileceğini anlatırken bunun ile birlikte bu süreçte ne tür sorunlar ile karşılaşabileceğinizi ve metal sağlığınızdan nasıl kaybetmeyeceğinizi, ele alıyor olacağım.

data.name: Yapay Zeka: Toplumsal Devrimin Anahtarı mı, Yoksa Etik Çıkmazın İçinde miyiz?
data.detail:
Yapay Zeka: Toplumsal Devrimin Anahtarı mı, Yoksa Etik Çıkmazın İçinde miyiz?

Türkiye Java Community olarak planladığımız canlı yayında sizi geleceğin belirleyici unsurlarından biri olan "yapay zeka" dünyasına davet ediyoruz. Yapay zeka, teknolojinin hızla ilerlediği günümüzde, toplumsal bir devrimin anahtarı olabilir mi? Yoksa etik sorunlar ve çıkmazlar bizi bekliyor mu? Bu soruların cevaplarını birlikte keşfedeceğiz.

 

Tevfik Uyar

İstanbul Teknik Üniversitesi Uçak mühendisliği mezunudur. Yüksek Lisans ve Doktora derecelerini İstanbul Kültür Üniversitesi İşletme Yönetimi Anabilim dalından almıştır. Çalışmaları risk algısı, belirsizlik altında karar verme ve mantıksal safsatalar üzerinedir. Bugün podcast kanalı olarak yayın hayatına devam eden Açık Bilim Dergisi’nin kurucu editörlerinden ve Yalansavar yazarlarından biridir. 2011-2013 yılları arasında Açık Bilim Radyo Programı’nın yapımcılığını ve sunuculuğunu gerçekleştirmiştir. 3'ü bilimkurgu olmak üzere altı adet yayımlanmış kitaba ve dört adet de çeviriye sahiptir.

 

Bizi desteklediği için ana sponsorumuz DefineX'e teşekkür ederiz.

data.name: RxJava ile Java'da Reactive Programlama
data.detail:
Java dünyasında reaktif programlamanın temeli olan RxJava'nın temellerine derinlemesine bir bakış atacağız. Async ve event-based sistemlerin nasıl daha verimli ve anlaşılır hale getirilebileceğini keşfedeceğiz. RxJava'nın sunduğu zengin operatör seti ve etkileyici hata yönetimi özellikleri ile reaktif uygulamalarınızı nasıl optimize edebileceğinizi öğreneceksiniz. İster yeni başlayan, ister deneyimli bir Java geliştirici olun, bu yayın RxJava'nın dünyasına adım atmanız için mükemmel bir fırsat sunacak

 

Bizi desteklediği için ana sponsorumuz Definex'e çok teşekkür ederiz!

data.name: Yazılım Geliştirmede Siber Güvenliğin Önemi
data.detail:
We will discuss what Cyber ​​Security is, its importance, and precautions. It will be a highly secure presentation where we will evaluate the benefits of cyber security in software development and secure code development methods.

 

Our topic will be a cyber analysis of software products developed in the real world and the foundations of trust in the end user. It will be an event where we will make comments about what we should pay attention to in developing secure code.

 

Abdullah Engin Çağlayan

Senior Cyber ​​Security Specialist.  Çağlayan, who started his career in the Information Technologies and Electronic Security sector in 2009, directed his career to the field of Cyber ​​Security in 2019.  It provides services to companies and institutions on penetration testing and code analysis.  He worked in many positions such as Project Manager and Manager.  He currently continues to work as an Information Technologies and Cyber ​​Security Senior Manager at Mavinci Bilişim.

 

Thanks to our main sponsor, DefineX, for making this great event happen.

data.name: Nesne Yönelimli Yazılım Tasarım Desenleri 3 (Object Oriented  Design Patterns)
data.detail:
Tasarım Desenleri nedir, yazılımcılara ne fayda sağlar? 

Sunumda "Design Patterns, Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software" kitabında bahsedilen paternleri tanıyacağız. Paternlerin amacı, gerçek projelerden kullanım örnekleri ve Java dili ile temel implementasyonlarına bakacağız.

 

Sunumda en yaygın kullanılan paternlere değineceğiz. Sunumu tek bir oturumda tamamlamak zor olacağı için 2 veya 3 oturum şeklinde planlıyoruz. İlk oturumda SOLID ve GRASP gibi tasarıma yonelik ve mimari prensipler ile Inheritance, Polymorphism, Dependency Injection gibi temel kavramlardan bahsedeceğiz. Sonrasında ise Builder, Singleton, Factory Method, Adapter, Decorator, Proxy, Command, Memento, Observer, Strategy, Template Method ve State paternlerini incelemeyi planlıyoruz.

 

Bizi desteklediği için ana sponsorumuz DefineX'e teşekkür ederiz.

data.name: The Power of Event-Driven Architecture
data.detail:
This presentation will cover the fundamental concepts, advantages, and use cases of Event-Driven Architecture. Additionally, it will delve into prominent Event-Driven Architecture and Patterns such as Publish-Subscribe, Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS), and Event Sourcing, explaining each with real-world application examples. The presentation aims to provide participants with a foundational understanding of Event-Driven Architecture and its associated patterns and practices.

 

Furkan Gulsen, a Beykent University Software Engineering graduate, began his career as a Fullstack Developer at Ollang during his second year of university. Over approximately three years, he gained experience in backend, frontend, DevOps, and AI. Later, he focused on backend and DevOps, joining ikas, an e-commerce solutions company, as a Backend Engineer. Alongside his technical career, Furkan has been actively involved in the management of six different communities over the last five years. He is passionate about creating open-source projects and sharing his knowledge with peers.

data.name: GraalVM
data.detail:
This presentation will explore the fundamental concepts, advantages, and practical applications of GraalVM. It will delve into the key features of GraalVM, including its polyglot capabilities, native image generation, and high-performance characteristics. Additionally, the presentation will showcase real-world use cases and examples of how GraalVM can be leveraged to enhance application performance and efficiency across different programming languages and environments. The aim is to equip participants with a foundational understanding of GraalVM and its potential impact on modern software development

 

Muhammet Ali KAYA is a Computer Engineer, Expert Software Trainer, and the CTO of Beeme. Kaya began his software career in 2002 by developing applications for institutions. Since 2004, he has been providing group software training for individuals. He has held roles as a consultant and team leader in various private and public organizations, working on European Union projects. He specializes in Java, JavaEE, Spring Boot, DevOps, System Architectures, and Database Systems. Currently, he serves as an Expert Java Trainer at a software company and holds the position of CTO at BeeMe startup project. Sharing his knowledge and consistently exploring new technologies are among his greatest passions.

data.name: İş Zekası ve Veri Analitiği
data.detail:
Business Intelligence and Data Analytics

 

In today's competitive business world, the ability to utilize data and technology in real time has become one of the most critical parameters for success. In the constantly evolving business environment, the need for business intelligence and data analytics is crucial to gain a competitive advantage. Business intelligence enables statistical analyses, anomaly detection, querying, and reporting activities.

 

In this event, we will discuss the necessity of business intelligence, how this concept operates, the significance of data visualization in today's context, the importance of data analytics in business intelligence, and the future positioning of business intelligence.

 

Ece Gençay - Senior Business Intelligence Developer/Data Engineer

 

A graduate of Ankara University with a degree in Statistics, Ece Gençay has worked as a business intelligence specialist in various sectors. She has worked on business intelligence projects for both public and private entities, including TIM, the Presidency of the Republic of Turkey Strategy and Budget Directorate, the Ministry of Environment and Urbanization, Coastal Safety, Beyaz Web, and Ankara Metropolitan Municipality. Currently, she is actively working as a Senior Business Intelligence Developer/Data Engineer at HepsiJET, contributing as both a developer and an analyst in numerous projects that require business intelligence, data analysis, and data engineering.

 

We extend our sincere gratitude to our primary sponsor, DefineX, and our venue sponsor, Ankara Tekmer, for their invaluable support in making this event a success.

data.name: Nesne Yönelimli Yazılım Tasarım Desenleri (Object Oriented Design Patterns)
data.detail:
Object-Oriented Design Patterns

 

In this presentation series, we will explore design patterns, which are standardized solutions to common design challenges in software engineering. Our focus will be on understanding and implementing the patterns discussed in the book 'Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software.' The goal is to recognize these patterns, showcase real-world examples, and provide basic implementations in the Java programming language.

 

The presentation will be divided into 2 or 3 sessions due to its comprehensive nature. In the first session, you will cover design principles such as SOLID and GRASP, along with fundamental concepts like Inheritance, Polymorphism, and Dependency Injection. Following that, you will delve into the examination of widely used design patterns in subsequent sessions. The selected patterns include Builder, Singleton, Factory Method, Adapter, Decorator, Proxy, Command, Memento, Observer, Strategy, Template Method, and State.

 

This structured approach aims to provide a thorough understanding of both foundational design principles and practical design patterns, offering a valuable resource for developers to enhance their coding skills and create robust and maintainable software solutions.

 

"The leading role of our event is Mustafa Ilıkkan-Senior Software Developer at Özgür Yazılım A.Ş."

 

Thanks to our main sponsor, DefineX, for making this great event happen.

data.name: Yazılımcılar İçin Yol Haritası & Kariyer Sohbetleri
data.detail:
Roadmap and Career Discussions for Software Developers

 

In this event, we plan to listen to career stories from professionals in the software development industry and discuss topics such as the potential roadmaps we can chart for ourselves.

 

Moreover, we aspire for this to be an interactive event, providing the opportunity to ask questions that you may have.

 

Our Speakers:

 

Evren Tan - Engineering Manager at Property Finder

Our community leader, whom you all know.
 

Mert Bahardoğan - Software Engineer at Trendyol Group

Mert has been in the software development industry for 2 years. Currently, he is working at Trendyol Group. He enjoys learning new things and sharing his knowledge with the community through articles on Medium and technical presentations.
 

Ayşe Aktağ - Cyber Security Specialist at TurkNet

Ayşe is a graduate of Computer Engineering. Throughout her career, she has worked in Telecommunications and Consulting firms. Currently, she is working at TurkNet as a Cyber Security Specialist. She is involved in Vulnerability Management, Network Security, and Penetration Testing.

 

Merve Başak - Business Analyst at YapıKredi Technology

Merve has been working in the industry as a business analyst since 2020. Her current position is as a Senior Business Analyst at Yapıkredi Technology. Additionally, she actively supports volunteer initiatives with different communities. 

 

We extend our sincere gratitude to our primary sponsor, DefineX, and our venue sponsor, Ankara Tekmer, for their invaluable support in making this event a success.

data.name: DevOps: Orchestrating Success in Software Development
data.detail:
Join us for an insightful exploration into the world of DevOps, where seamless collaboration and efficient workflows converge to drive success in software development. In this live event, we will unravel the principles, practices, and tools that form the backbone of DevOps, transforming traditional development processes into a well-orchestrated symphony of innovation.

Our expert speakers will delve into key topics such as continuous integration, continuous delivery, and automation, showcasing real-world examples of how DevOps principles have revolutionized the software development lifecycle. From fostering a culture of collaboration between development and operations teams to optimizing deployment pipelines, we will dissect the components that contribute to achieving faster, more reliable, and scalable software delivery.

Whether you're a seasoned DevOps practitioner or just starting your journey, this event promises valuable insights, best practices, and actionable strategies to elevate your software development practices. Discover how DevOps acts as the catalyst for accelerated innovation, improved product quality, and enhanced collaboration, ultimately orchestrating success in the dynamic landscape of software development.

Mark your calendars and join us for a deep dive into the world of DevOps – where code meets collaboration, and success is orchestrated.

 

Ertuğrul Şen 

Yazılım dünyasında 8 yıldır deneyim kazandım ve DevOps ile otomasyon alanında uzmanlaştım.

Şu anda Definext'te DevOps Architect olarak 4 yıldır çalışıyorum.

Sürekli kendimi geliştirmeye odaklanmış, teknik becerilerimi ve

iletişim yeteneklerimi her zaman ileriye taşımak için çaba gösteren biriyim.

Mühendislikteki tutkumun yanı sıra, drone uçurmayı ve yemek yapmayı da seviyorum.

data.name: Your Java isn't the same
data.detail:
In the most recent survey, 50% of developers are using Java 11 or older. With a new Java version released every six months, many developers needed help following the language changes. This presentation will cover the main changes to each version after Java 11 up to Java 20, including Variable Type Inference (var), Records, Switch expressions, Text Blocks, Sealed Classes, Hidden Classes, Pattern Matching, virtual threads, and much more.

 

About: Chandra is a Sr. Distinguished Engineer at BNY Mellon. Chandra is a technologist in the financial services industry since 2003 and has been programming with Java since 1998. Chandra was selected as a 2019 Java Champion. He is a Java User Group (JUG) Leader, and helps run one of the largest Java user groups, NYJavaSIG and a founder-leader at the Garden State JUG. Chandra conducts code workshops and Code Katas on core Java features. He is a frequent speaker at Java user groups, and technology conferences including Oracle CodeOne, Oracle Code NY, QCon New York, Devnexus, DawsCon and GIDS India.

data.name: Sihirli Değnek - Test Otomasyonu
data.detail:
Serkan bize sihirli değnek olarak görünen test otomasyonun aslında ne olduğu ve nasıl yönetilmesi gerektiği üzerine konuşacak. Test otomasyonu aslında bir süreç olduğunu ve dongi içinde kaliteli ürün çıkarmak için sadece birçok araç ve yöntemden biri olduğunu anlatacak. 

 

Serkan Cura, Bursa'da doğdu ve 2013 yılından bu yana İstanbul'da yaşıyor. Farklı alanlarda 10 yılı aşkın tecrübesiyle zenginleştirdiği, müşteri odaklı, takım çalışması ve çevik çalışmanın önemini bilen bir lisans diplomasına sahiptir. Jotform'da Test Otomasyon Takım Lideri olarak çalışmaktadır. Daha önce Digiturk, Intertech ve Getir'de farklı kıdemlerde QA olarak çalışmıştı. ISTQB CTFL sertifikasına sahip, aynı zamanda balıkçılık ve amatör denizcilik sertifikalarına sahip bir deniz tutkunu. 

 

Bizi desteklediği için ana sponsorumuz DefineX'e çok teşekkür ederiz!

data.name: Monitoring Spring Boot Application with Prometheus and Grafana
data.detail:
Monitoring Spring Boot Application with Prometheus and Grafana

In our event, we will delve into the process of monitoring Spring Boot projects. Our focus will be on how to monitor Spring Boot projects and provide requests using Prometheus and Grafana.

 

Hasan Burak Kutbay 

Burak has been working professionally as a Java developer in the industry for 9 years. He is currently working as "Senior Software Developer" at Migros One. He likes to convey what he has learned, writes blogs about the information he has acquired, and makes YouTube videos.

 

https://blog.burakkutbay.com/

 

We extend our sincere gratitude to our primary sponsor, DefineX, and our venue sponsor, Ankara Tekmer, for their invaluable support in making this event a success.

data.name: How does DynamoDB provide predictable performance at any scale?
data.detail:
How does DynamoDB provide predictable performance at any scale?

DynamoDB is a serverless NoSQL database that offers high availability and predictable performance at any scale. This means that customers experience the same single millisecond latency profiles regardless of how big their DynamoDB tables get in time. In this talk, we will dive into how DynamoDB achieves this capability. DynamoDB's architecture offers various lessons on how to design a highly available, low-latency service at a planetary scale.

 

EVREN ÖNEM

Evren Onem holds a BSc. in Maths, and an MSc. in Computer Engineering from Bogazici University. From his early engineering years, Evren had a continuous passion for scalable backend systems. He performed various software engineering roles in Turkey and Ireland, across start-ups, scale-ups, medium-sized global companies, as well as Big Tech. He is currently a Senior Manager of Software Engineering at AWS, heading up DynamoDB's Control Plane and Platform Services organization.

 

Thanks to our main sponsor, DefineX, for making this great event happen.

data.name: Java 21 Features and More
data.detail:
Java 21 Features and More

A month ago, one of the LTS versions, Java 21, was released. This version includes many important features. First of all, we will be discussing the versioning system and preview features in Java. Then we will talk about these new features and related topics. We will examine these both theoretically and practically.

Oğuzhan Caner

Oguzhan has been working with Java, Spring, Hibernate, and related technologies for about five years since university internships. After graduating from the Computer Engineering department of Konya Technical University, He started his professional career in Etiya and worked there for approximately two half years. Nowadays, he is working as a backend developer at Yildiz Tech company for 6 months. Also the co-organizer of the Turkiye Java Community for a half year.

Onur Aktaş

Onur works on Java and Java technologies. At the same time, he continues his education at Kocaeli University, Department of Industrial Engineering. He worked for 1 year as a Java Backend Developer. He is currently a co-organizer in the Turkiye Java Community and Istanbul events organizer. He is interested in algorithm problems and wants to work on optimization in the future.

 

Thanks to our main sponsor, DefineX, for making this great event happen.

data.name: Clean & Hexagonal Architectures and Domain Driven Design Practices
data.detail:
Ali Gelenler

Clean & Hexagonal Architectures and Domain Driven Design Practices

 

Clean Architecture is a combination of design principles aimed at isolating the core business logic from external dependencies. It facilitates the creation of independent business logic in applications, allowing for the modification of external dependencies without affecting the core logic. This, in turn, enables the development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of robust and long-lasting applications.

 

In this presentation, we will explore how Clean Architecture principles can be practically applied in conjunction with Hexagonal Architecture and Domain-Driven Design.

 

Presentation Main Topics:

 

1- What is Clean Architecture, and How Is It Applied in Practice?

2- Hexagonal Architecture - Ports & Adapters: What Is It?

3- Translating Clean Architecture and Domain-Driven Design into

data.name: Financial Innovation with JAVA: A Deep Dive to Modern Solutions
data.detail:
Financial Innovation with JAVA: A Deep Dive to Modern Solutions

To be a part of our event that is being hosted by DefineX and TJC, please fill out the participation form. Confirmation of your acceptance or non-acceptance to the event will be communicated via email. Only 30 participants are allowed to attend the event. Check your email accounts regularly for updates on your participation status.

 

 

Huseyin BABAL

Software Developer

 

Bio: Building SaaS applications for challenging technologies within a Multi-Cloud environment by using Kubernetes at core architecture. I have also architectured Microservice and DevOps Transition for big-scale projects.I use Java, Spring Boot, Golang, and Kubernetes for SaaS applications. Ex. Sony and eBay engineer

 

 

Mastering Microservices with Spring Boot: Embracing the Saga Pattern

Abstract: Distributed data management is a core challenge in microservices architecture. This talk introduces the Saga Pattern as a solution, ensuring data consistency across Spring Boot microservices without traditional distributed transactions. We'll explore both choreography and orchestration approaches, providing practical implementation insights. Attendees will see production-grade examples for the Microservices from local development up until to the production environment.

 

Fawaz Ghali

Principal Data Science Architect and the Head of Developer Relations at Hazelcast

 

Bio: Fawaz Ghali is the Principal Data Science Architect and the Head of Developer Relations at Hazelcast with +22 years of experience in DevRel, cloud, enterprise software development and deployment, ML/AI and real-time intelligent applications, management, and leadership. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science and has worked in the private sector as well as in academia and research. He has published +45 scientific peer-reviewed papers in the fields of ML/AI, data science, and cloud computing on Google Scholar. Fawaz is a renowned expert with +200 talks and presentations at global events and conferences.

 

Real-time Payment Processing without Migraines

Abstract: Payment Processing delays can be considerably reduced via speed, scalability, and stability. Investigating payment processing and fraudulent activities, using fraud detection machine learning is crucial where decisions need to be made in microseconds, not seconds or even milliseconds. This becomes more challenging when things get demanding and scaling real-time fraud detection becomes a bottleneck. The talk will address these challenges and provide solutions using a combination of real-time storage and computing that provides a unique synergy for real-time use cases at any scale.

 

 

Serkan Susantez

Senior Architect

 

Bio: An experienced technology architect and innovator with a strong background in finance and telco industries. As the leading partner of the technology architecture and innovation labs team, I am responsible for driving the development of cutting-edge solutions that solve complex business challenges. With a focus on SaaS platforms, I have led teams in the design and implementation of innovative solutions that have resulted in significant cost savings and improved efficiency for our clients. I am passionate about leveraging technology to drive business growth and improve the user experience.

 

Deep Observability in Microservices: Strategic Insights for Business Excellence

Abstract: In today's rapidly evolving digital landscape, the agility and resilience of microservice architectures are paramount. However, as these distributed systems grow in complexity, so does the challenge of understanding their health and performance. This talk delves into the strategic importance of enhancing observability within Java-based microservice applications. We will explore tools and techniques for logging, monitoring, and metric collection, emphasizing their role in swiftly identifying issues, tracking system performance, and even predicting future challenges. Attendees will gain insights into how deep observability plays a pivotal role in ensuring business continuity, optimizing customer experience, and driving operational efficiency.
